intro: Dimerocostus bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored daisy, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow and white ray florets. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Dimerocostus bicolor is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
